channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Repairs have lasted less than 24hrs - immediate site revisit required, 26th November
item.description:
FixMyStreet ref: 6654383 - urgent site revisit required for depression spanning Hatherley Road near entrance to Hatherley Gate. This was repaired just last Fri 22nd November but due to the depression, the patch repair has turned into a larger hole and now causing even more impact on our property with HGVS and double decker buses using this route. This needs to be addressed and repaired immediately. I would also appreciate someone making contact to discuss. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
How have you not sorted this road out yet, it's an abomination and a disgrace to Cheltenham. I dare you to pop your car on cruise control at 30mph and try to not explode your wheels. Absolutely ludicrous

item.title: Two large potholes in depression in road, which had been fixed last week but unfortunately deteriorated already. Causing damage to nearby property., 25th November
item.description:
On Hatherley Road, just past the entrance to Hatherley Gate, heading away from Lansdown, on the side of road nearest Hatherley Gate. The pothole is linked to a depression spanning the full width of the road, where there’s an existing fill for some kind of previous roadworks. The potholes had been fixed last week, but the patch has already deteriorated and all the tarmac has been thrown out by car tyres travelling over it. I note that the recent fix was very minimal, and I wonder if vehicles dropping into the depression create extra wear on the pothole locations - and whether a larger patch that also addresses the larger depression would help. The original pothole had been causing a nearby house to vibrate when large vehicles bounced through it; the recent fix had temporarily alleviated the problem slightly, but it’s now in a much worse state. Any large vehicles (including every bus on that route) drop into the depression and further into the pothole, causing very noticeable shock waves through to a neighbouring house. These are disturbing the sleep of both our two young children, as well as ourselves who both work locally, especially my wife who is a teacher. If it’s possible to address the larger depression and smooth it out for all traffic, beyond only the pothole, we would really, really appreciate it! Please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Runoff from stables causing severe damage to road surface, 25th November
item.description:
Water is running off from stables on green lane below St Bartholomew's Church and runs in a torrent right down green lane to the stile where some goes across fields, the rest carrying on to The Green. The high curb at the edge of the road constrains the water on the road surface where it is eroding the road. If the curb can be altered to allow the water to run off into the hedge and field it would reduce damage to the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Manhole cover dropping suddenly, 25th November
item.description:
The manhole cover outside 160 London Road is now dropping sharply when driven over, which is especially dangerous for motorbike riders, resulting in a significant risk of a traffic accident, especially in the rain/snow. There are schools in the area and high pedestrian traffic volumes, creating even more concern for vehicles losing control.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, London Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a sunken drain cover in the northbound carriageway. It has been previously reported in November 2023 under Web Reference: 5212149 Enquiry Number: 22034128, and again in June 2024 under reference FixMyStreet ref: 6109829. It appears to have not been fixed, or at least any repair previously made was not long lasting. Would suggest it needs digging out, the edge reinforcing, and then the drain cover being put back so that it is flush with the surface of the road. Please could this be attended to as it presents a danger/risk of damage to car tyres/suspensions or worse still for cyclists etc., 25th November
item.description:
In the northbound carriageway after the no entry evesham road junction on the right, but before Stollards Close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerbside drain blocked, 25th November
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for more than a year now, the water flows down Bushcombe lane every time that it rains. This will inevitably freeze during periods of cold weather, causing hazards and damage to road surfaces..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Close, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes & almost no tarmac suface left., 25th November
item.description:
The problem, of which there are many further down the road, is directly outside my bungalow. I have reported this several times over a period of years. I have been told its NOT deep enough. It cannot go deeper as it looks like the original ' concrete' type base. It is dangerous to drivers & pedestrians when crossing the road. I've lived here for almost 60 years & can only recall any repairs happening just ONCE. The road is a disgrace.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Beaumont Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
